data.title: Parking Pro Basic Set Up
data.body:
1. Select a Teams channel where to install Parking Pro. Keep in mind that everybody in the channel will have access to Parking Pro.

    üëÄ We recommend creating a specific channel for Parking Pro to help users find the app easily in Teams.

  2. Start by naming to Parking Pro tab (1), the name should be related to the user case. For example, are you using Parking Pro to manage EV charging stations? EV Parking. Then, click on 'Manage parking' (2). Here, you'll be asked to add the parking spots available on your parking place. Add parking spots (3) and click 'Save' (4).

    ‚ÑπÔ∏è Not sure which how many parking spots to add? No worries, you can always modify the parking spots from Settings.

  3. Next step: click the ‚öôÔ∏è button, and select '‚öôÔ∏è Settings' (5). Here you can personalize the view of your Parking Pro: select the 'Default display mode' (6) and the 'First day of the week' (7).

  4. Continue to 'üõ°Ô∏èPermissions' (8), where you can choose between 'Everybody can edit' or 'Only the creator (you) can edit' (9).

    ‚ÑπÔ∏è For more information about permission, check out this article.

  5. Finally, select 'üè∑Ô∏èTag management' (10), and create the tags (11) needed to filter and manager the bookings.

    ‚ÑπÔ∏è On this article, we explain in details how to use tags to make the most of Parking Pro.

data.title: How to use tags to manage and filter parking spaces in Parking Pro?
data.body:
Click on the Settings button ‚öôÔ∏è next to the 'Week' button > select 'üè∑Ô∏è Tag management' (1). A new dialog will pop up.

On the Tag management section you can create (2 - 3) and edit your tags.

For this particular example, we will explain the case of Contoso.

Contoso uses Parking Pro to manage parking spaces across multiple office locations. They want to categorize reservations by types such as "Employee," "Guest," and "Executive."

The company has created tags (4):
üôã‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüôãEmployee
üì® Guest
üíº Executive

Users can then filter the parking view by these tags (5) to quickly identify available spots for specific reservation types.

The users can also specify the type of reservation when completing the booking (6).

Thanks to the tag system, the company can categorize the type of reservations to better manage their parking spaces.

‚ÑπÔ∏è Users will need a Parking Pro premium license to be able to use tags.

data.title: How can I use tags in Parking Pro?
data.body:
Using tags to filter your reservations is a powerful way to personalize and streamline your Parking Pro management.

This feature allows you to categorize your reservations based on different criteria such as Team members, VIPs, guest users, etc. By adding tags, you can quickly and efficiently find the reservations that are most relevant to you, cutting through the clutter and enhancing your productivity.

For example, using tags to filter events such as your colleagues' holidays is a great way to keep track of who's in and out of the office.


To start using this feature, simply create a '+ New' event. Under the Advanced section of the event options, you'll find 'Tags'. Enter the name of the tag and click on '+ Add'.

data.title: How to change the permission to make changes to Parking Pro?
data.body:
Click on the Settings button ‚öôÔ∏è next to the 'Week' button > select 'üõ°Ô∏èPermissions'. A new dialog will pop up.

  1. If you want everyone in the channel to be able to modify Parking Pro, please select 'Everybody in this channel can add/edit events' > Save.

  2. If you prefer the owner to retain exclusive editing rights to Parking Pro, please select 'Only the creator of this Parking Pro can add/edit events' > Save.

‚ÑπÔ∏è The creator is the individual who added the Parking Pro tab, and there is only one creator for each tab.

‚ö†Ô∏èCurrently, granular/selective permissions are not available. For example, it's not possible to allow some users to add events but not delete them, or to assign different permission levels to different users.

If you'd like to see this kind of detailed control over permissions in the future, we encourage you to suggest it on ideas.teams-pro.com

data.title: How to Set Up Gantt Chart Pro?
data.body:
To make the most out of Gantt Chart Pro in effectively managing your project, follow these steps:

  1. Install Gantt Chart Pro within your project team or channel.

    ‚ÑπÔ∏è If you want to prevent other team members from removing the Gantt Chart Pro project tab, adjust the team permissions accordingly. You can find more information here: Microsoft Teams Tabs Permissions.

  2. After installing Gantt Chart Pro on your channel tab, access the 'Settings' and configure the following:

  • Adjust the 'View' (1) based on the project's duration.

  • Add 'Participants' (2) which refers to the team members responsible for task assignments.

  • Define 'Working hours' (3) according to your schedule.

  • Choose whether to include weekends (4) in the planning.

Once your configuration is set, confirm the changes by clicking 'Confirm.'

data.title: How to import a KeePass Pro .KDBX file into a new KeePass Pro channel tab?
data.body:
1) Copy the Master password from the KeePass Pro vault that you wish to transfer to a different tab. Learn the process from this article.

2) Select the '+' symbol to add a new tab, and look for KeePass Pro. Access the 'Configuration' menu and pick 'Clone existing vault (Encryption AES)' (1). Subsequently, press the 'Choose a file' (2) button located under Vault location.

3) Browse and choose the kdbx file associated with the original KeePass Pro, the one intended for importing. If it doesn't show up, press 'Refresh'. If it's still absent, verify its presence by examining the 'Files' section.

Click on 'Use this vault' (3) and then 'Save' (4). This action will establish a new 'Vault' for securely importing the passwords from the initial KeePass Pro.

If needed, rename of the new vault and (5) insert the password copied during Step 1. Then, click 'Save' (6).

The new KeePass Pro tab will emerge on the channel, containing the imported passwords.

data.title: How to Add or Remove Participants from Gantt Chart Pro?
data.body:
Collaboration is key to successful project management. Adding and managing participants in Gantt Chart Pro enhances collaboration and ensures efficient teamwork throughout the project lifecycle. Here's how you can add or remove participants:

1. Click the 'Settings' button.

2. In the 'Participants' section, enter the names of the participants you wish to include in the project. Press 'Confirm'.

When you create a new task by clicking '+ Add', or when you edit an existing task, the participants you added to the project will be listed in the 'Participants' tab. From there, you can assign participants to the task and customize the percentage of their dedication to the task.

data.title: I accidentally deleted my Calendar, or somebody deleted it? How can I restore it?
data.body:
We appreciate how essential your data and configurations are for seamless operations. That's why we provide a premium technical support service that aids users like you in reclaiming their Calendar Pro data.

Here are the particulars for recovering your Calendar Pro:

  • The process of recovering the Calendar Pro to a new tab falls under Paid technical support.

  • The current cost of this service is $175.

  • To begin the recover and access step-by-step instructions, please visit our support page at https://restore.teams-pro.com/.

  • This page provides a comprehensive guide on successfully transitioning your Calendar Pro to a new tab.

To recover your Calendar Pro, follow these steps:

1. Choose the app you want to recover.

2. Locate the channel link where the Calendar Pro was originally:

  • Position your cursor over the channel that contains the Calendar Pro you want to recover.

  • Click the three-dot icon that appears to the right of the channel name.

  • This will prompt a dropdown menu.

  • Choose 'Get link to channel'.

  • A dialogue box with the link to the channel will pop up.

  • Please copy this link, paste it in the space provided below, and hit 'Search'.

3. Paste the Channel link and click 'Search'. A list of Calendar Pros will be displayed. Click on the 'Restore' button to bring back the Calendar Pro that was removed.

4. Review and follow the instructions on the subsequent screen.

5. Proceed to make the payment.

Recovery duration varies between 2 to 48 hours, depending on the number of events and our team's availability.

‚ö†Ô∏è NOTE:

The recovery of Calendar Pro is limited to:

‚úÖ The same channel (Channel A ‚û°Ô∏è Channel A) within the same team and tenant.

We cannot recover a Calendar Pro:

‚ùå From one channel (Channel A) to a different channel (Channel B).
‚ùå From one team's channel (Channel A in Team A) to another team's channel (Channel B in Team B).

‚ùå From a tenant A deployment to tenant B.

data.title: What is license and how does it work?
data.body:
In order to use Teams Pro features to the fullest, users need to understand what are licenses and how it actually works.

License is a right of a user to view, edit and delete the events inside each Teams Pro application. Even if you want 10 users just to view all premium features, you still need to purchase 10 licenses for them.

The first person, who purchases Teams Pro or logs in to the Admin Center is considered as an Owner and the Admin of Teams Pro (it can be Calendar Pro, KeePass Pro or Gantt Chart or any other Teams Pro solution).

After purchasing the licenses, an Admin needs to assign those licenses to the users. They can do so on https://admin.teams-pro.com

Owners can also assign other Admins on https://admin.teams-pro.com.

If an Admin has changed in your corporation, and you need to assign a new Admin-Owner, please contact our Customer Support.

All the Admins will be responsible to assign new users who will ask request. Hence, only Admins will receive emails to assign new users per their request.

Be aware: in order to become an Admin in existing subscription, do not log in into https://admin.teams-pro.com yet, but main Admin and Owner needs to assign you an Admin license. If you have already logged in to https://admin.teams-pro.com, but want to become part of Active subscription, you need to delete your initial account on Admin Center and wait for a main Admin to assign you as another Admin.

MOST FREQUENT ANSWERED QUESTIONS:

Who is considered an Admin?

An Admin is the person who purchased Teams Pro solution. Simple login does not make a user an Admin. In order to become an Admin please purchase our solution or contact our Customer Support.

What are the Admin rights?

An Admin can do following:

  • Have an access to Admin Center (https://admin.teams-pro.com)

  • Purchase new Teams Pro applications;

  • Unsubscribe from any Teams Pro subscriptions;

  • Assign new users with license to view, add, edit or delete events/tasks

  • Assign new Admins, who can assign other licenses.

What is a license?

License is the right to have an access to Teams Pro data. With the license a user can view all events/tasks, add, edit or delete them.

Who can purchase, assign and revoke license?

Any person can purchase Teams Pro, but only an Admin can assign and revoke licenses.

Do all employees need a license?

Only the users who will interact with Teams Pro (add, edit, delete or view the events/tasks) need the license.

What happens if the Admin left the company?

If the Admin left the company and you still need Teams Pro solution, please contact Customer Support.

data.title: How to cancel your subscription
data.body:
1. Go to https://admin.teams-pro.com and sign in with the exact same account you used when you bought your licenses.

    üö® Remember: you have to use the same email address you used to buy the licenses. If you don't, you'll get an error message.

  2. After you've successfully logged in with the correct account:

    1. Find your Profile name and click on it.

    2. From the drop-down menu, click on "Billing". This will open a new window.

    3. In the new window, find the subscription you want to stop, and click on it.

    4. Then, click on "Cancel Subscription".

    5. You'll be asked to provide a reason for stopping your subscription. You can just type in a brief explanation.

    6. Lastly, confirm you want to cancel by clicking on "Confirm cancellation".

data.title: What is the difference between the new and the old Calendar Pro billing model?
data.body:
Before, 1 Calendar Pro = $11.99, 2 Calendar Pro = $23.98 and so on. From the 18th January 2022, 1 user = 1 license = unlimited Calendar Pro Premium. The price will start at $0,29 user/month.

For example, the company Contoso uses Calendar Pro to manage five different projects in 5 channels. These projects have a Project Manager, John, and ten project executives.

Former billing model

Contoso was paying for these 5 Calendar Pro a total of $59.95 yearly ($11.99 per Calendar Pro Premium). Everybody in the project could use the premium features of Calendar Pro (Recurrent events and print calendar).

However, the premium features were only applicable to these specific Calendar Pro. Whenever they needed another Calendar Pro Premium for another project, the company had to pay $11.99.

John and all project executives had access to premium features for 5 Calendar Pro Premium.

New billing model

Contoso pays a total of $59.29 yearly for 11 premium licenses. Everybody in the project can use the Premium Calendar Pro features and use unlimited Calendar Pro Premium.

Contoso doesn't have to pay for an additional Calendar Pro Premium anymore when starting a new project.

John and all project executives have access to all premium features for unlimited Calendar Pros.

What happens if someone in the team doesn't have a license?

Let's say that John is welcoming an intern, Megan, to the project team. Megan doesn't have a Calendar Pro license, yet she can still see the content of the Calendar Pro, create and modify new events. She has access to Calendar Pro, but she can't use the premium features.

data.title: What is a KeePass Pro vault?
data.body:
A KeePass Pro vault is like a highly secure digital safe for all your different passwords. Just like a physical vault protects valuable items, the KeePass Pro vault safeguards your online passwords. This vault is locked with a "master" key, which could be a password or a special file, or both. Once it's locked, the vault is then stored in SharePoint, a platform that provides additional layers of security and allows for easy access when you need to retrieve your passwords.

To better visualize it, imagine you have a big bunch of keys for different rooms. Now, instead of carrying all these keys with you, you keep them in a secure box. To open this box, you only need one main key. In this analogy, the box is your KeePass Pro vault, the room keys are your various online passwords, and the main key to open the box is your master password.

This system is helpful because you just need to remember your master key, and it takes care of the rest, giving you access to all your different passwords securely. Plus, it uses very advanced methods of encryption (just like complex, high-tech locking systems) to make sure your passwords are as safe as possible. The vault, with all of its secured passwords, is then safely stored on SharePoint.

data.title: How can I add tags to my events?
data.body:
Using tags to filter your events is a powerful way to personalize and streamline your Calendar Pro view.

This feature allows you to categorize your events based on different criteria such as project, team, or task type. By adding tags, you can quickly and efficiently find the events that are most relevant to you, cutting through the clutter and enhancing your productivity.

For example, using tags to filter events such as your colleagues' holidays is a great way to keep track of who's in and out of the office.


Click on the Settings button ‚öôÔ∏è next to the 'Month' button > select 'üè∑Ô∏è Tag management' (1). A new dialog will pop up.

On the Tag management section you can create (2 - 3) and edit your tags.

For this particular example, we will explain the case of Contoso.

Contoso uses Calendar Pro to manage employees Paid Time Off (PTO) across multiple office locations. They created a tag for each of the employee (4) so managers can filter down the calendar by employee (5).

Employees and manager can tag PTO from the main event creation page (6).


‚ÑπÔ∏è Users will need a Calendar Pro premium license to be able to use tags.

data.title: How to clean the Microsoft Teams cache?
data.body:
Clear Teams cache in Windows

  1. If Teams is still running, right-click the Teams icon in the taskbar, and then select Quit.

  2. Open the Run dialog box by pressing the Windows logo key

    +R.

  3. In the Run dialog box, enter %appdata%\Microsoft\Teams, and then select OK.

  4. Delete all files and folders in the %appdata%\Microsoft\Teams directory.

  5. Restart Teams.

Clear Teams cache in macOS

  1. If Teams is still running, right-click the Teams icon in the dock, and then select Quit, or press Command (‚åò)-Q.

  2. In the Finder, open the /Applications/Utilities folder, and then double-click Terminal.

  3. Enter the following command, and then press Return:

    Console

  1. rm -r ~/Library/Application\ Support/Microsoft/Teams

  2. Restart Teams.

data.title: Generating a HAR file for troubleshooting
data.body:
This file is a log that can help you identify and troubleshoot performance issues. We'll be using Google Chrome for this guide as it's one of the most common browsers, but the steps should be quite similar in other modern browsers.

1. Open Google Chrome

2. Go to the webpage you want to troubleshoot.

  1. https://teams.microsoft.com/

  2. Navigate to the application you want to troubleshoot.

3. Open Developer Tools

  • You can do this by right-clicking anywhere on the webpage and selecting "Inspect" from the context menu.

  • Alternatively, you can press F12 or Ctrl + Shift + I on your keyboard.

4. Go to the Network tab in Developer Tools

  • You'll see a lot of network requests listed here when you interact with the page. If the list is already filled, you can clear it by clicking the "clear" button (it looks like a circle with a line through it).

  1. Make sure the record button is red

    • This button is located in the top left corner of the Network tab. If it's grey, click it to start recording. If it's red, you're already recording.

  2. Click the Clear button

  3. Check the box next to Preserve log

5. Perform the action that causes the issue

  • This step is important because it lets you capture exactly what's happening when the problem occurs.

6. Save the .HAR file

  • After the problem has occurred, right-click anywhere in the network request list and select "Save all as HAR with content".

  • Give your .HAR file a name and save it to a location that you'll remember.

  • Wait for the 'Content Collection' to finish before closing.

Now, you have a .HAR file that you can send to your developers or technical support for troubleshooting! It's a snapshot of what happened when the issue occurred, which can help them identify and fix the problem.

data.title: How can I edit/modify an occurrence in recurrent event?
data.body: Click on the event > click on Edit icon > make the required changes > Save.

data.title: How to find the settings?
data.body: Click on the drop-down arrow next to the specific tab of Booking Room Pro > Settings.

data.title: How many resources can I add in free model of Booking Room Pro?
data.body: You can add and have access to up to 3 resources in free model of Booking Room Pro.

data.title: How many resources can I add in premium model of Booking Room Pro?
data.body:
You can add and have access to unlimited resources in Premium model of Booking Room Pro.

*The users in the channel with the free or basic model will only have access to up to 3 resources.

data.title: How can I manage my resources?
data.body:
After you are done setting the tab > Manage resources > +Add a resource > Save.

Also, you can change it through the settings in the drop-down arrow next to the specific tab, making the required changes in the resources (add or delete) through Manage resources and then saving it.

data.title: How to get the event info?
data.body: Click on the specific event > Edit > Information.

data.title: How to change the time zone?
data.body: You can adjust the time zone using the (1) drop-down arrow located at the top of the Booking Room Pro view or (2) From the booking options.

data.title: How to use tags in Booking Room Pro?
data.body:
Click on the Settings button ‚öôÔ∏è next to the 'Week' button > select 'üè∑Ô∏è Tag management' (1). A new dialog will pop up.

On the Tag management section you can create (2 - 3) and edit your tags.

For this particular example, we will explain the case of Contoso.

Contoso uses Booking Room Pro to manage meeting rooms across multiple office locations. They want to categorize reservations by types such as "Employee," "Guest," and "Executive."

The company has created tags (4):
üôã‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüôãEmployee
üì® Guest
üíº Executive

Users can then filter the booking view by these tags (5) to quickly identify the different bookings.

Users can also specify the type of reservation when completing the booking (6).

Thanks to the tag system, the company can categorize the type of reservations to better manage their meeting spaces.

‚ÑπÔ∏è Users will need a Booking Room Pro premium license to be able to use tags.

data.title: If I am a user with license of KeePass Pro, will the other members also have access to unlimited passwords that I save and generate in KeePass Pro?
data.body: 1 license is assigned to 1 person and in that case they can create, store, share, save and get access to as many passwords as they want. But if the member of that channel are using the free/basic model then they can have access to up to 3 passwords.

data.title: How to add distribution lists to my Distribution Lists Pro?

data.title: How to chat with a person?

data.title: How to start a group chat?

data.title: How can I get the application working again if I have revoked the permission to access my Teams profile?
data.body:
This can be done with the help of the admin who has credentials for the organizational level admin center. They can give grant or permission to the third party application and this shall be solved.

Also, normally you can refresh the apps and it asks for the consent again. In worst case you can disconnect your Microsoft account and reconnect to open your calendar and then the application ask consent again which you can grant.

data.title: How can I get the Product ID?

data.title: How to see the error through the browser link?
data.body: Kindly open your teams application in browser > click on three dots at the top right (next to browser address bar > more tools > developer tools > console. Kindly take a screenshot of the error message and share.

data.title: How to download the invoices for the subscription purchased?
data.body:
1. First, sign in to the Admin Center using the same username and password you used when you bought your subscriptions. Then, click on your Profile name. A menu will pop up. Click on the word that says 'Billing'.

2. When you're in the Billing section, look for 'Billing History' and click on that.

3. You'll see a list of everything you've bought with your subscription. Find the 'Download' button and click it to save the bill as a pdf.

data.title: How to change the permission to make changes to Calendar Pro?
data.body:
Click on the Settings button ‚öôÔ∏è next to the 'Week' button > select 'üõ°Ô∏èPermissions'. A new dialog will pop up.

  1. If you want everyone in the channel to be able to modify Calendar Pro, please select 'Everybody in this channel can add/edit events' > Save.

  2. If you prefer the owner to retain exclusive editing rights to Calendar Pro, please select 'Only the creator of this Calendar Pro can add/edit events' > Save.

‚ÑπÔ∏è The creator is the individual who added the Calendar Pro tab, and there is only one creator for each tab.

‚ö†Ô∏èCurrently, granular/selective permissions are not available. For example, it's not possible to allow some users to add events but not delete them, or to assign different permission levels to different users.

If you'd like to see this kind of detailed control over permissions in the future, we encourage you to suggest it on ideas.teams-pro.com

data.title: Can an external Teams user have access to KeePass Pro in private channel?
data.body:
No, a Microsoft Teams user from outside your organization does not have the capability to access KeePass Pro in a private channel.

We've implemented this policy to maintain the utmost privacy of your passwords.

data.title: Can we edit a single occurrence which is a part of a series of recurrent events in Calendar Pro?
data.body:
Yes, we can edit a single occurrence which is a part of a series of recurrent events in Calendar Pro.

Click on the desired occurrence which is a part of the recurrent series > Click on Edit > Click Edit Occurrence > make required changes > Save.

data.title: How to see the series Id of a recurrent event series in Calendar Pro?
data.body: Click on any of the series which is a part of the desired recurrent series > Click on Edit > Click Edit Occurrence > Click on Information > there you have your Serie ID.

data.title: Blank screen popup after sign in
data.body:
When you sign in Calendar Pro and you have a blank pop-up.

The workaround is to popup the tab and to login.

In case the issue persists despite the log in and appears with a blank screen, then kindly log in to Teams through the web browser and give consent to the application through the small pop-up window.

Once done, you can have access with ease in the Teams application as well.

Just follow these steps:

  2. Open Map Pro tab > click on the three dots next to Trips > Connect > Select Contacts Pro from the drop down arrow in the pop-up box > paste the unique identifier > Save.

data.title: How can I connect my Calendar Pro with Map Pro?
data.body:
Click on the Help button ‚ùî next to the Settings ‚öôÔ∏è button > select ' ‚ÑπÔ∏è About' (1).

A new dialog will pop up with the Calendar Pro 'Unique Identifier' (2)

Open Map Pro tab > click on the three dots [...] next to Trips > Connect (3) > Select Calendar Pro from the drop down arrow in the pop-up box > paste the unique identifier (4) > Save.

data.title: What is the time duration to recover the deleted Calendar Pro tab?
data.body: There is no fixed time duration and you can recover your deleted Calendar Pro tab any time.

data.title: How to import a KDBX file in KeePass Pro?
data.body:
1. Create a new vault, you can choose the location, then you can click the location to show files of SharePoint folder:

2. Click on the vault location which is in purple, (marketing in this case), a new tab will open to the location.

3. Now you can upload a file in the folder.

4. Going back in KeePass Pro, you have to select "clone existing vault" under configuration.

5. Then choose a file. If nothing appears, you can click the refresh button at the top right corner, the file will appear. Then select it.

6. Now you have to enter the master password and click on "save".

All password of your database will be imported into KeePass Pro.

Important Note:

  • Make sure that the passwords are encrypted in AES format.

  • You can clone only databases from SharePoint folder of the channel where KeePass Pro is installed.

data.title: Is Calendar Pro integrated with Power BI?
data.body: Calendar Pro is not integrated with BI but you can use the developer.teams-pro.com which is part of the Calendar Pro Platinum Version.

data.title: What is a Widget?
data.body: A widget is an interface for any TeamsPro application which gives you the access to the application. It directly connects you to the application tabs in the channel.

data.title: How can I add Widget to the Home Pro Dashboard?
data.body: Click on the three dots at the top right > EDIT > select the widget > OK.

data.title: How can I configure a widget?
data.body: Click on CONFIGURE > choose the application > Select > fill in the unique identifier of the application > Save.

data.title: How can I Rename a widget?
data.body: Click on the three dots at the top right of the respective widget > Rename > make the changes > Confirm.

data.title: How can I resize a widget?
data.body: Click on the three dots at the top right of the respective widget > Resize > Select a size from the options given in the drop-down menu > Confirm.

data.title: Where can I get the settings of the widgets?
data.body: Click on the three dots at the top right of the respective widget > Settings.

data.title: How can I navigate through a widget?
data.body: You can navigate with the help of arrows inside the widget.

data.title: How do I change the Unique ID in the widget?
data.body: Click on the three dots at the top right of the respective widget > Settings > copy and paste the Unique id of the application > save.

data.title: How can I reset a widget?
data.body: Click on the three dots at the top right of the respective widget > Reset > Confirm.

data.title: How can I hide a widget?
data.body:
You can hide a widget through two ways:

1. Click on the three dots at the top right of the respective widget > Hide widget.

2. Click on the three dots at the top right > EDIT > select the widget move the toggle to left > OK.

data.title: How many widgets can I add?
data.body: You can add 15 widgets at max.

data.title: How to synchronize Outlook with Calendar Pro?
data.body:
‚ö†Ô∏è To sync Outlook with Calendar Pro, you'll need both a Calendar Pro Platinum subscription and either a Microsoft Power Automate subscription or access to Azure Logic Apps. This Power Automate flow will allow you to synchronize any Outlook Calendar to Calendar Pro and NOT the other way around.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Open Microsoft Power Automate and start a new 'Automated Cloud Flow'.

Label the flow as 'Outlook to Calendar Pro Sync' (1), then choose 'When an event is added, updated, or removed from a Calendar'(2) as the trigger. Hit 'Create'.(3)

2. In the dropdown menu, pick the Outlook calendar you want to sync with Calendar Pro.

Press '+ New Step' and look for Calendar Pro.

3. Enter the required details. (Check here to locate your Calendar Pro ID). Tap 'Save'.

‚ÑπÔ∏è If it's the first time you're using Calendar Pro Power Automate connector, you will need to enter your API key, which is available on your developer.teams-pro.com account profile.

data.title: Gantt Chart Pro Premium
data.body:
Dear Customer,

We are grateful to you for being part of Gantt Chart Pro community! As you know, Gantt Chart Pro is relatively young application, that gained success in the short amount of time thanks to you.

Teams Pro team is constantly working on improving, updating and fixing Gantt Chart Pro, so you can track and monitor your tasks without any issue. Therefore, from 15th of December 2022 Gantt Chart Pro will become license-based paid application.

Don't worry! Gantt Chart Pro will have 2 types of usage: Freemium and Premium. In the Freemium mode you will be able to have 5 tasks with 1 sub-task per each task, you will also be able to add up to 3 participants to your tasks and monitor their progress. You will be able to add notes, dependencies and set your deadlines.

However, if you have created more than 5 tasks and you added more than 3 participants, I would advise to you to go for Premium version. All your data is securely stored by Teams Pro team and is not lost but waiting for you. One of the greatest advantages on Premium Gantt Chart is that you can integrate it with Azure DevOps now!

To purchase Gantt Chart Pro you will see the link to the Admin Center, where you can purchase as many licenses as you need for the Gantt Chart. The best part is that the more licenses you get, the more likely you will get a price dropped.

We want to thank you for your support and to reassure you that we are doing our best to bring the best experience to you of Your Project Management on Gantt Chart Pro. And we do have a gift for you, for the first 5000 users, who would like to stay with us, we will give away the discount coupons for the subscription! üôÇ

For any questions, queries, comments please go to the Admin Center (the link: https://www.admin.teams-pro.com ) and we will gladly help you out.

The Coupon code: WELCOMEGANTTCHARTPRO üôÇ

Your Teams Pro Team.
